sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A mittimus to the iubile at Rome: or, The rates of the Popes custome-house Sent to the Pope, as a New-yeeres-gift from England, this yeere of iubile, 1625. And faithfully published out of the old Latine copie, with obseruations vpon the Romish text, by William Crashavv, Batchelor of Diuinity, and pastor at White-Chappell. Taxa cancellariae apostolicae. English Catholic Church. Cancellaria Apostolica. Crashaw, William, 1572-1626. aut
[18], 44, [2], 70 p.
Printed by G[eorge] P[urslowe] for Iohn White, and are to be sold at his shop, at the signe of the Holy-Lambe, in Little-Brittaine, neere Aldersgate-Street, London : M.DC.XXV. [1625]
A translation of: Taxa cancellariae apostolicae. An exposé of the prices of indulgences under Pope Leo X. Consists primarily of commentary by Crashaw. Title page in red and black. "The rates of the Popes custome-house. The second part .. Printed by George Purslow" has separate dated title page and pagination; register is continuous. M4 is cancelled. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

A translation of: Taxa cancellariae apostolicae. An exposé of the prices of indulgences under Pope Leo X. Consists primarily of commentary by Crashaw. Title page in red and black. "The rates of the Popes custome-house. The second part .. Printed by George Purslow" has separate dated title page and pagination; register is continuous. M4 is cancelled. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
